constpool

Class UTF8Info

  • java.lang.Object
    • constpool.UTF8Info
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConstantType

    public class UTF8Info
extends java.lang.Object
implements ConstantType
    A class that represents UTF-8 (style) strings. This is a literal, so ConstantPools are irrelevant. Somewhat analogous to the String type in Java.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      short length
      The amount of bytes needed.
      byte[] values
      The bytes that represent a String

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UTF8Info(short length, byte[] values)
      A Simple Constructor.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String asString()
      Constructs a String based on the binary values, using the String(byte[]) constructor.
      static int getLength()
      This value is extremely hard to use, because it is variable length, and a constructor must be called in order to get the length.
      int getRequiredLength()
      Returns the required length of this entry into the ConstantPool.
      byte getTagNumber()
      This will return the unique byte used to indicate what type of entry this is.
      java.lang.String getType()
      Returns the type, usually just getClass().getName()
      java.lang.String getValueAsString(ConstantPool pool)
      This will parse values, usually deciphering bytes into data.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns the String representation of the Object, which is the class name and the asString() function.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • length

        public final short length
        The amount of bytes needed. This is variable, based on the length of the String.

      • values

        public final byte[] values
        The bytes that represent a String

      • getRequiredLength

        public int getRequiredLength()
        Description copied from interface: ConstantType
        Returns the required length of this entry into the ConstantPool. Should always return the same as getLength() in subclasses.
        Specified by:
        getRequiredLength in interface ConstantType

      • getLength

        public static int getLength()
        This value is extremely hard to use, because it is variable length, and a constructor must be called in order to get the length. Here, it returns the first two bytes.
        Returns:
        An unhelpful number.

      • getTagNumber

        public byte getTagNumber()
        Description copied from interface: ConstantType
        This will return the unique byte used to indicate what type of entry this is.
        Specified by:
        getTagNumber in interface ConstantType

      • asString

        public java.lang.String asString()
        Constructs a String based on the binary values, using the String(byte[]) constructor.
        Returns:
        the String representation.

      • getValueAsString

        public java.lang.String getValueAsString(ConstantPool pool)
        Description copied from interface: ConstantType
        This will parse values, usually deciphering bytes into data. Most subclasses will assign the result to a variable automatically.
        Specified by:
        getValueAsString in interface ConstantType
        Parameters:
        pool - the ConstantPool data is gotten from

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the String representation of the Object, which is the class name and the asString() function.
